oai_dc:dc.dc:description: MRS. L. C. FRENCH HEADS STATE SUFFRAGE LEAGUE The executive committee of the Tennesseee Equal Suffrage league has named Mrs. L. Crozier French of Knoxville, president succeeding Miss Sarah B. Elliott, resigned. Nashville was selected as the convention city for the national gathering. Mrs. L. Crozier French is one of the most prominent woman's suffrage leaders in the south, and is also widely known wherever woman's suffrage leagues are organized as one of the strongest champions of women's rights. She has been heard in addresses in many states and cities in the interest of votes for women. Mrs. French organized the Knoxville Equal Suffrage league and has been active in the league since its inception. She is a member of the executive council of the state league.— Nashille special.
